meetings.title: January
speaker: Jenny Crusie
meetings.time: Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
Motif and Metaphor

Guest speaker Jenny Crusie will discuss motif and metaphor in fiction. Motif and metaphor are ways to deepen your storyâ€™s meaning without putting that meaning blatantly on the page. Through careful analysis of your completed first draft, you can find the things that you unconsciously put into your story and enhance them to create the kind of emotional subtext that draws a reader in without hitting her over the head with MEANING.

meetings.title: February
speaker: Donna MacMeans
meetings.time: Networking at 12:00 pm, Business meeting at 12:30 pm, Speaker at 1:30 pm
meetings.topic:
The Other HEA: Grab Your Readers with Emotional Attachment

In order for a reader to care about a story, they must care about the characters. Learn how employing rooting interests in your stories that will create an emotional attachment-- without the reader ever realizing how you manipulated their emotions.
